    void delete()
    Deletes a sprite and all of its components
    Runs Component.delete() for all components
    Sprite and components enter object pool for reuse

    RectSprite getAdjacentColliderAt​(float x, float y)
    Tests collision at a relative position of a sprite for every RectSprite in SpriteManager.entityList with default hitbox size Shorthand for getColliderAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);
    RectSprite getAdjacentColliderAt​(float x, float y, float hitBoxSizeX, float hitBoxSizeY)
    Tests collision at a relative position of a sprite for every RectSprite in SpriteManager.entityList Shorthand for getColliderAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);

    Tests collision at a relative position of a sprite for every RectSprite in an arraylist Shorthand for getColliderAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);

    java.util.ArrayList<RectSprite> getMultipleAdjacentCollidersAt​(float x, float y)
    Tests adjacent collision at a position for every sprite in SpriteManager.entityList using default hitbox size.
    Unlike getAdjacentColliderAt(float, float), returns multiple sprites.
    java.util.ArrayList<RectSprite> getMultipleAdjacentCollidersAt​(float x, float y, int max)
    Tests adjacent collision at a position for every sprite in SpriteManager.entityList using default hitbox size.
    Unlike getAdjacentColliderAt(float, float), returns multiple sprites.

    Unlike getAdjacentColliderAt(float, float), returns multiple sprites.

    Tests collision at a position for every sprite in SpriteManager.entityList using default hitbox size.
    Unlike testCollisionAt(Vector2, Vector2), returns multiple sprites.
    Has no maximum.

    Same as getTrajectoryRayCast(Vector2, float, int, Vector2) but returns the position it hits

    Returns width

    Returns X position

    Returns Y position
    RectSprite initial()
    Runs Component.initial() on call for all components
    Will only print stacktrace if DebugManager.printInitialStackTrace is true
    MUST BE CALLED MANUALLY, CAN ONLY BE RAN ONCE
    boolean isPlayingAnimation()
    Returns true if animation is being played
    void lookAt​(float x, float y)
    Sets a sprite position to look at a position
    void lookAt​(float x, float y, float offset)
    Sets a sprite position to look at a position with rotational offset

    Sets a sprite position to look at a position

    Sets a sprite position to look at a position with a rotational offset

    Sets a sprite position to look at a position with a rotational offset

    void mirror​(boolean x, boolean y)
    Mirrors a sprites texture
    void mirrorX​(boolean x)
    Mirrors a sprites texture on the X axis
    void mirrorY​(boolean y)
    Mirrors a sprites texture on the Y axis
    void move​(float x, float y)
    Moves a sprite X and Y
    Shorthand for sprite.setX(sprite.getX+x);
    void move​(float x, float y, float multiplier)
    Moves a sprite x and y, and mutliplies them by multiplier
    Shorthand for sprite.setX(sprite.getX+x);
    void move​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 vector2)
    Moves a sprite vector.x and vector.y
    Shorthand for sprite.setX(sprite.getX+x);
    void move​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 vector2, float multiplier)
    Moves a sprite vector.x and vector.y, multiplying them by multiplier
    Shorthand for sprite.setX(sprite.getX+x);
    void moveInDirection​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 direction, float amount)
    Moves a sprite amount in a direction
    void moveInDirection​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 direction, float amountX, float amountY)
    Moves a sprite amountX along the X axis and amountY along the Y axis
    void moveInDirection​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 direction, float amount)
    Moves a sprite amount in a direction
    com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 north()
    Returns a position north of a sprite Shorthand for (sprite.x,sprite.y+1)
    com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 northEast()
    Returns a position north-east of a sprite Shorthand for (sprite.x+1,sprite.y+1)
    com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 northWest()
    Returns a position north-west of a sprite Shorthand for (sprite.x-1,sprite.y+1)
    void playAnimation​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Float time)
    Plays an animation for a sprite
    Animation must be made using AnimationManager.addAnimation(String, AnimationFrame...) or AnimationManager.addAnimationArray(String, AnimationFrame[])
    void playAnimation​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Float time, int amount)
    Plays an animation for a sprite
    Animation must be made using AnimationManager.addAnimation(String, AnimationFrame...) or AnimationManager.addAnimationArray(String, AnimationFrame[])
    void reset()
    Cleans and clears a sprite, completely resetting all of its values
    Is called when requesting a new RectSprite using SpriteManager.requestRectSprite()
    RectSprite setEqualTo​(RectSprite sprite)
    Will attempt this sprite equal to another sprite, overriding its values to make it theoretically the same.
    It is possible one of the component's variables' value will be messed up, specifically references.
    void setHeight​(float num)
    Sets height
    void setHitBoxOffset​(float x, float y)
    Sets the hitbox's offset from the sprite's position Hitbox position will be set to (x+offset.x, y+offset.y) during collision testing
    void setHitBoxOffset​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 offset)
    Sets the hitbox's offset from the sprite's position Hitbox position will be set to (x+offset.x, y+offset.y) during collision testing
    void setHitBoxSize​(float width, float height)
    Sets hitbox size
    void setHitBoxSize​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 size)
    Sets hitbox size
    void setHitBoxSize​(java.lang.Float colSize)
    Sets hitbox size
    Width and height are both set to colSize
    void setHitBoxSizeWithMultiplier​(java.lang.Float colSize)
    Sets hitbox size to a multiple of SpriteManager.baseObjectSize
    void setLayer​(int layer)
    Sets this sprite's layer, or the order which the sprite is drawn
    void setPosition​(float x, float y)
    Sets position
    void setPosition​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 positionVec2)
    Sets position
    void setPosition​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 positionVec3)
    Sets position
    void setScale​(float xy)
    Sets a sprite's scale to xy
    void setScale​(float x, float y)
    Sets a sprite's scale to x,y
    void setSize​(float size)
    Sets Sprite size
    This will not affect collision
    void setSize​(float width, float height)
    Sets Sprite size
    This will not affect collision
    void setSize​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 size)
    Sets Sprite size
    This will not affect collision

    Sets a sprites texture
    OVERRIDES DEFAULT TEXTURE

    Sets a sprites texture

    Sets a sprites texture
    void setTiling​(boolean renderWithTiling)
    Sets tiling for a sprite, uses SpriteManager.baseObjectSize for width and height
    void setTiling​(boolean renderWithTiling, int tilingWidth, int tilingHeight)
    Sets tiling for a sprite

    Sets width
    void setX​(float x)
    Sets X position
    void setY​(float y)
    Sets Y position

    Returns a position south-west of a sprite Shorthand for (sprite.x-1,sprite.y-1)

    boolean testAdjacentCollisionAt​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 positionVec2, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 hitBoxSize)
    Tests collision at a relative position of a for every RectSprite in SpriteManager.entityList with default hitbox size Shorthand for testCollisionAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);
    boolean testAdjacentCollisionAt​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 positionVec2, RectSprite rectSprite)
    Tests collision at a relative position of a sprite to see if specified sprite is colliding with default hitbox size Shorthand for testCollisionAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);
    boolean testAdjacentCollisionAt​(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 relativePosition, java.util.ArrayList<RectSprite> rectSprites, com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 hitBoxSize)
    Tests collision at a relative position of a sprite for every RectSprite in an arraylist Shorthand for testCollisionAt(sprite.getX()+x, sprite.getY()+y);

    java.lang.String toString()
    Returns: this.getClass().getName() + "N:" + name + "(" + x + ", " + y + ")" if the sprite has a name
    Otherwise returns: this.getClass().getName() + "T:" + textureName + "(" + x + ", " + y + ")"
    void update()
    Called every frame, runs Component.update() for all components
    Will only print stacktrace if DebugManager.printUpdateStackTrace is true
    Must run initial() before update()
    void updateAnimation()
    Called every frame
    Updates a sprites animation
    com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector3 west()
    Returns a position west of a sprite Shorthand for (sprite.x-1,sprite.y)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • setEqualTo

      public RectSprite setEqualTo​(RectSprite sprite) throws java.lang.NoSuchFieldException, java.lang.IllegalAccessException
      Will attempt this sprite equal to another sprite, overriding its values to make it theoretically the same.
      It is possible one of the component's variables' value will be messed up, specifically references. WIP
      Parameters:
      sprite - the sprite you want to set equal to
      Returns:
      the sprite after the change
      Throws:
      java.lang.NoSuchFieldException
      java.lang.IllegalAccessException

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Returns: this.getClass().getName() + "N:" + name + "(" + x + ", " + y + ")" if the sprite has a name
      Otherwise returns: this.getClass().getName() + "T:" + textureName + "(" + x + ", " + y + ")"
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
